item.title: Patapon 1+2 Replay gets Boss Rush Challenge mode as part of update 1.09
item.content:encoded:
Patapon 1+2 Replay has received a brand new mode as part of update 1.09, challenging players to take on the Boss Rush Challenge. To access the Boss Rush Challenge players need to complete the main campaign. The Boss Rush Challenge will vary the number of bosses per stage with higher difficulty, and they will get progressively stronger. HP and army strength will carry over through a stage and when a Patapon falls they will do so without dropping a cap, but all health will be restored once fully completing a stage. Along with the new Boss Rush Challenge, there are some additional fixes too.

Patapon 1+2 Replay 1.09 update patch notes

  • Fixed an issue causing unintended behavior in some text displays on the WORLD MAP in PATAPON and PATAPON 2.
  • Fixed a graphical issue that occurred with some Patapon units in Patapon 2.

Sound Bug Fixes

  • Fixed a bug in Patapon where the “CHAKA” sound would not play when inputting the command for the “Earthquake Miracle.”
  • Fixed a bug where performing specific actions when selecting save data would cause the game to become unable to progress.
  • Fixed a bug in PATAPON 2’s HEAD QUARTERS where performing specific actions would result in unintended unit formations.
  • Fixed a bug in PATAPON 2’s Paragate where performing specific actions would cause the game to become unable to progress.

Other Bug Fixes

  • Fixed a bug where certain key assignments would fail to register correctly in the key configuration settings within the OPTIONS menu.
  • Fixed a bug in PATAPON 2 where some Patapons would not perform the correct animation when inputting the command for the “PON CHAKA Song (Charge).”
  • Fixed a bug in PATAPON 2’s Paragate where camera controls would become disabled while the retreat dialog was displayed.
  • Fixed a bug in PATAPON 2’s Paragate where the “Deploy” action guide would disappear when hovering the cursor over the player’s Hero unit.

Other Adjustments

  • In the OPTIONS menu, the input timing setting values have been updated to add a “+” symbol for the positive values “1” through “5.” A tooltip has also been added to clarify that “Set – to adjust timing judgment toward earlier inputs.”

Source: Steam
